author: Satoshi Nakamoto
content: Documents related to William Hinman, the former director of the SEC's Division of Corporation Finance, were released on June 13, 2023, in relation to the SEC's lawsuit against Ripple. This led to a 7.4% increase in the price of the XRP token as optimism grew that Ripple would win their ongoing case. Ripple and its supporters have argued that the released emails could reveal a biased or flawed process behind Hinman's 2018 speech suggesting that Ethereum may not be a security. However, the emails do not mention Ripple or XRP directly. Ripple's Chief Legal Officer, Stuart Alderoty, claimed that the emails showed Hinman ignoring warnings about the legality and confusion surrounding securities designations. But, the initial analysis of the emails did not provide a significant advantage for Ripple Labs. XRP's price retracted after a brief rally on the day of the email release, indicating some disappointment. Before the release of the documents, Ripple and XRP supporters had focused on Hinman's statements suggesting that a token is not a security if it is "sufficiently decentralized." Ripple has argued that XRP is "sufficiently decentralized" like Ethereum and should not be classified as a security based on Hinman's standards. Critics, however, question the claim that Ethereum and XRP are similarly decentralized. The question of whether Ripple should be considered the creator and issuer of the XRP token has been debated and litigated for almost a decade. Ripple Labs allies argue that the company is separate from XRP, while critics see it as an orchestrated deception. Additionally, if XRP was effectively created or issued by Ripple, this would differentiate it from Ethereum, which has no for-profit parent company. The price of XRP generally reacts to new information that supports or damages Ripple's side of the case.
title: William Hinman Emails Matter to XRP Army & Crypto's Price
